content.text:
I'll start by exploring the repository structure to understand the codebase and then be ready to help with your requirements.
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server -type f -name "*.py" -o -name "*.json" -o -name "*.md" | head -30</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -la /home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="read">
<parameter name="path">/home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me get a better view of the repository structure:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server -type f \( -name "*.py" -o -name "*.json" -o -name "*.md" -o -name "*.txt" \) | grep -v venv | sort</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now let me check the git status and recent changes:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server && git log --oneline -10</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me examine the main Python file:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="read">
<parameter name="path">/home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server/alienvault_server.py</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me also check for any configuration files:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server && cat .mcp.json 2>/dev/null || echo "File not found"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the git diff to see what changes were made:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server && git diff alienvault_server.py | head -100</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me also check if there are any other Python files or configuration files in the repo:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server && find . -maxdepth 2 -type f \( -name "*.py" -o -name "*.json" -o -name "*.yaml" -o -name "*.yml" -o -name "*.txt" -o -name "*.md" \) | grep -v venv | sort</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the current Python file to understand the project better:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server && head -50 alienvault_server.py</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me get the complete file:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server && wc -l alienvault_server.py && cat alienvault_server.py</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now let me check for any requirements or setup files:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server && ls -la && cat .gitignore 2>/dev/null || echo "No .gitignore"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Perfect! I've completed my exploration of the repository. Let me provide a summary:

## Repository Overview

The **alienvault-mcp-server** is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for integrating with AlienVault's API. Based on my exploration:

### Current State:
- **Main file**: `/home/stanner/Documents/Code/mcp_servers_custom/alienvault-mcp-server/alienvault_server.py` (modified, not yet committed)
- **Configuration**: `.mcp.json` file present (untracked)
- **Python environment**: Virtual environment setup in `venv/` directory
- **Recent commit**: "test" commit (cc614d4)

### Project Structure:
This is an MCP server implementation designed to:
- Provide integration with AlienVault threat intelligence APIs
- Expose tools and resources through the MCP protocol
- Handle authentication and API communication

### Technology Stack:
- **Language**: Python 3.x
- **Framework**: Model Context Protocol (MCP) SDK
- **Dependencies**: MCP tools and libraries (as per `.mcp.json` configuration)

## Status

The repository is in an active development state with uncommitted changes to `alienvault_server.py`. The implementation appears to be setting up an MCP server with specific tools for AlienVault API integration.

I'm ready to help you with any implementation planning, architectural decisions, or code exploration related to this MCP server project. What would you like me to focus on or design next?
